item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry.

summary.text:
Green Mountain National Forest Adjustment Act of 2005 - Modifies the boundaries of the Green Mountain National Forest to include all parcels of land identified in the forest maps entitled "Green Mountain Expansion Area Map I" and "Green Mountain Expansion Area Map II", each dated February 20, 2002.

Provides for the boundaries of Green Mountain National Forest, as adjusted by this Act, to be considered to be the boundaries of such National Forest as of January 1, 1965, for the purposes of provisions relating to the allocation of land and water conservation funds for Federal purposes pursuant to the Land and Water Conservation Fund Act of 1965.

bill.title: Green Mountain National Forest Adjustment Act of 2005

item.title: Green Mountain National Forest Adjustment Act of 2005
Green Mountain National Forest Adjustment Act of 2005
A bill to adjust the boundaries of Green Mountain National Forest.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
